official-title.#text: To amend the National Flood Insurance Act of 1968 to allow the repair, expansion, and construction, without elevation, of agricultural structures located in special flood hazard zones, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Subsection (a) of section 1315 of the National Flood Insurance Act of 1968

header.#text: Requirements for State and local land use controls

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: may not, for purposes of such paragraph, be considered to be inadequate or inconsistent with the comprehensive criteria for land management and use under
because such measures provide that, in the case of any agricultural structure that is located in an area having special flood hazards, a variance in accordance with

may be granted, and the Administrator may not suspend a community from participation in the national flood insurance program, or place such a community on probation under such program, because such land use and control measures provide for such a variance.

text.#text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Act, the land use and control measures adopted pursuant to
in the case of new construction, the agricultural structure is subject to base flood elevations of at least three feet;
in the case of existing structures, it is not practicable to elevate the repaired or expanded structure to the base flood elevation;
the structure is located within 5 miles of active agricultural operations; and
not more than one claim payment exceeding $1,000 has been made for the structure under flood insurance coverage under this title within any period of 10 consecutive years.

A variance in accordance with this subparagraph is a variance, granted by an appropriate official of the community, from compliance with such land use and control measures that allows for the repair, expansion, or construction of such agricultural structure without elevation of the structure, but only after a determination by such appropriate official that—

term.#tail: means any agricultural product processing facility, agricultural product storage facility, shed, farmhouse, barn, or other structure which has as its primary purpose supporting the agricultural industry.

text.#text: For purposes of this paragraph, the term

header.#text: Allowable local variances for certain agricultural structures

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 1308 of the National Flood Insurance Act of 1968

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be the rate that otherwise would apply to such structure if the structure had been repaired, expanded, or constructed before the establishment of the special flood hazard area.

text.#text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Act, the chargeable premium rate for coverage under this title for any structure provided a variance pursuant to

header.#text: Premium rates for certain agricultural structures with variances

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 3315 IH: Agricultural Structures Building Act of 2013
